title: Hailee Steinfeld rocks an Eighties inspired look in an oversized plaid blazer and white tights
text:
She's currently on a whirlwind promotional tour for new series, Dickinson.

And Hailee Steinfeld pulled another stylish look out of the bag as she left her hotel in London en route to The One Show studios on Wednesday.

Clad in an Eighties inspired number, the 22-year-old actress was a vision of beauty on the outing.

Chic: Hailee Steinfeld pulled another stylish look out of the bag as she left her hotel in London en route to The One Show studios on Wednesday

Hailee sheathed her lithe frame in an oversized plaid blazer that she teamed with thigh-skimming matching shorts.

The Pitch Perfect 2 star added to the glamour by donning a plunging black top that offered a look at her cleavage.

She completed the look with a pair of white tights, whilst she injected some glitz with delicate hooped earrings.

Dressed to impress: Hailee sheathed her lithe frame in an oversized plaid blazer that she teamed with thigh-skimming matching shorts

During her appearance on The One Show, Hailee was asked about whether she feels a responsibility to her fans, having garnered an impressive 12 million Instagram followers.

'In ways I guess maybe,' Hailee mused. 'I feel the most responsibility to be myself and that's all I can be.'

Asked how she stays grounded with achieving success at such a young age, including being Oscar-nominated at 14 for her role in True Grit, Hailee thanked her family.

She explained: 'It's a very crazy thing, it's so surreal. I have my mum with me now and she's the one, she's the one who keeps me grounded.'

Taking the plunge: The Pitch Perfect 2 star added to the glamour by donning a plunging black top that offered a look at her cleavage

Finishing touches: She completed the look with a pair of white tights, whilst she injected some glitz with delicate hooped earrings

Hailee stars alongside Jane Krakowski and Toby Huss in Dickinson, a historical series that will be anything but a sleepy costume drama, with a focus on female empowerment and freedom of expression.

In Dickinson, Steinfeld plays the acclaimed American poet Emily Dickinson and is set during her youth in the mid-1800s.

The season of 10 30-minute episodes is billed as a show about the gender and social constraints on women and a costume dramedy with a modern slant.

Dickinson will premiere on November 1 on Apple TV+.
